Questions.Phrase: WHITE 3 is executing a throw-in from a position two metres outside the sideline. Correct decision?

Answers.Phrase: No decision required, as this is allowed
Repeat the throw-in without whistle signal
Repeat the throw-in after whistle signal

Questions.Phrase: BLACK 4 stands with one foot on the sideline and the other foot in the playing area. He executes a throw-in and scores a goal directly. Correct decision?

Answers.Phrase: Repeat the throw-in for BLACK team after whistle signal

Questions.Phrase: WHITE 6 executes a throw-in standing with one foot inside the court and the other foot one metre outside the sideline. He throws the ball into the goal of BLACK team. Correct decision?

Answers.Phrase: Repeated throw-in for WHITE team after whistle signal

Questions.Phrase: WHITE 11 takes a shot on goal. The ball rebounds from the crossbar and hits equipment, which hangs from the ceiling over the goal area of BLACK team. From there the ball falls down into the arms of goalkeeper BLACK 1. Correct decision?

Answers.Phrase: Free throw for BLACK team after whistle signal
Throw-in for BLACK team after whistle signal

Questions.Phrase: During the execution of throws following an interruption of the game, when is the defending team allowed to be closer than 3 metres from the ball?

Answers.Phrase: As soon as the referee has given the signal for the execution of the throw
When the ball has left the hand of the player executing a free throw
In case of a free throw or throw-in, when the players are positioned at their own goal-area line
During the execution of a goalkeeper throw or a throw-off, when the defending player is standing outside the goal area or the throw-off area.

Questions.Phrase: WHITE 5 fails to catch a pass. He runs after the ball and stops it before it crosses the sideline, but he himself cannot avoid crossing the sideline afterwards. Correct decision?
